reg_pit.title: Public Guardian and Trustee Fees Regulation

change.changenote: Schedule, item 13 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 162/2010, effective July 1, 2010.

tablerow.tablecol:
Wills Variation Act:
Examining Writ of Summons under section 3
Reviewing and commenting on a proposed settlement of a wills variation action

change.changenote: Schedule, item 3 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 146/2012, effective July 1, 2012.

tablerow.tablecol: Administering money in trust for a child under the conditions of employment set under section 9 (3) of the Act or section 45.14 of the Employment Standards Regulation, B.C. Reg. 396/95.
(i) 5% of the amount received and 5% of the income earned on it,
(ii) 0.4 of 1% per annum, computed monthly, on the gross value of all assets.

change.changenote: Schedule, item 4 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 148/2013, effective March 31, 2014.

tablerow.tablecol: (a) Acting as representative of estate under section 9 (1) (b) or sections 59 to 61
(b) Reviewing an application to the court under section 7 or 41 and providing comments
(d) Administering the estate of a deceased person or acting under section 51
(i) (A) 3% of gross value of real property conveyed to beneficiary or heir,
The estate, if funds available, otherwise the beneficiary or heir
(B) 5% of gross sale price of real property sold by agent,
(C) 7% of gross sale price of real property sold without agent
(D) 7% of cash received other than the sale of real property,
(E) 7% of the gross value of securities at the time administration commences and 7% of their growth in value,
On commencement of administration and on recognition of capital growth
(F) 7% of the gross value of other personal property,

The estate, if the property is sold or if it is transferred or delivered and if funds are available from the estate, or the beneficiary or heir, if the property is transferred or delivered and the funds are not available from the estate
On receipt of proceeds available from the estate, or before transfer or delivery if funds are not available from the estate
(G) If the sum of the amounts payable under clauses (A) through (F) is less than $3 500, then an additional amount is payable in the sum of $3 500 – ((A) + (B) + (C) + (D) + (E) + (F))
The estate, if the funds available, otherwise the beneficiary or heir
(iii) 0.4 of 1% per annum, computed monthly, on the gross value of all assets.
(iv) $75 per hour for staff time spent identifying, locating and proving heirs.

change.changenote: Schedule, item 13 BEFORE replaced by BC Reg 148/2013, effective March 31, 2014.

tablerow.tablecol: (a) Examining notice of civil claim under section 3
On service of notice of civil claim
(b) Reviewing and commenting on a proposed settlement of a wills variation action

change.changenote: Schedule, item 13, the following row was deleted by BC Reg 208/2013, effective March 31, 2014.

tablerow.tablecol: (b) Reviewing and commenting on a proposed settlement of a wills variation action

change.changenote: Schedule, items 14 and 15 were added by BC Reg 208/2013, effective March 31, 2014.
Schedule BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 154/2014, effective August 1, 2014.

oasis:entry.oasis:line: Acting under a support and assistance order under section 56
(i) 1% of the value of cash received as capital,
(iii) 0.4 of 1% per annum, computed monthly, on the gross value of all assets,
(iv) 1% of the gross value of all assets.
On termination of the support and assistance order

Community Care Facility Act:
Examining an application for consent under section 17 (2) (d) and (f).

Administering money in trust for a child under
(a) the conditions of employment set under section 9 (3) of the Act, or
(b) section 45.14 or 45.20 of the Employment Standards Regulation, B.C. Reg. 396/95.
(i) 5% of the amount received and 5% of the income earned on it,
(ii) 0.4 of 1% per annum, computed monthly, on the gross value of all assets.
Administering the estate of a missing person
(i) 3% of gross sale price of real property sold by agent,
(ii) 5% of cash received whether as capital or income, other than from the sale of real property by an agent,
(iii) 5% of the gross value of securities at the time administration commences and 5% of their growth in value,
On commencement of administration and on recognition of capital growth
(iv) 0.4 of 1% per annum, computed monthly, on the gross value of all assets,
(v) 5% of gross value of assets other than securities.
(d) Examining an application for the Public Guardian and Trustee's consent under section 40 (1) (a)
(i) $100, if the proposed amount is not over $1 500;
(ii) $250, if the proposed amount is over $1 500 but not over $5 000;
(iii) $300, if the proposed amount is over $5 000 but not over $10 000;
(iv) $500, if the proposed amount is over $10 000 but not over $15 000;
(v) $750, if the proposed amount is over $15 000 but not over $50 000;
(vi) $1 250, if the proposed amount is over $50 000 but not over $100 000;
(vii) $2 000, if the proposed amount is over $100 000 but not over $500 000;
(viii) $3 000, if the proposed amount is over $500 000;
(f) Examining documents or applications under section 49
On service of documents or application
(a) Responding to a notice of application under section 7
On service of notice of application
(b) Attending to passing of accounts under section 10 or 13:
(i) $125, for each 12 months reviewed, if the gross value of patient's assets is over $25 000 but not over $100 000;
On presentation of accounts for passing
(ii) $250, for each 12 months reviewed, if the gross value of patient's assets is over $100 000 but not over $300 000;
On presentation of accounts for passing
(iii) $325, for each 12 months reviewed, if the gross value of patient's assets is over $300 000 but not over $500 000;
On presentation of accounts for passing
(iv) $500, for each 12 months reviewed, if the gross value of patient's assets is over $500 000;
On presentation of accounts for passing
(i) $200, if there is a court application for discharge of committee;
(ii) $50, for review of documentation on death of patient, if there is no court application
(e) Acting as committee of the estate of a patient:
(i) 3% of gross sale price of real property sold by an agent,
(ii) 5% of cash received whether as capital or income, other than from the sale of real property by an agent,
(iii) 5% of the gross value of securities at the time administration commences and 5% of their growth in value,
On commencement of administration and on recognition of capital growth
(iv) 0.4 of 1% per annum, computed monthly, on the gross value of all assets,
(v) 5% of the gross value of all assets other than securities
(f) Acting under section 24 as committee of the estate of a patient after patient's death
$100 per month or pro-rated portion of it
Monthly commencing on the death of a patient until the receipt of a copy of the grant of letters probate of the will or letters of administration of the estate of the patient.
(a) Acting under section 6 as executor, trustee, attorney
(i) 3% of gross sale price of real property sold by an agent,
(ii) 5% of cash received whether as capital or income, other than from the sale of real property by an agent,
(iii) 5% of the gross value of securities at the time administration commences and 5% of their growth in value
On commencement of administration and on recognition of capital growth
(iv) 0.4 of 1% per annum, computed monthly, on the gross value of all assets,
(v) 5% of gross value of assets other than securities
(b) Acting under section 7 as litigation guardian
(c) Making investigation and audit under section 17 (1)
(i) $125, if the gross value of assets in trust or, if the investigation and audit does not relate to a trust, the gross value of the estate, is not over $100 000;
(ii) $200, if the gross value of assets in trust or, if the investigation and audit does not relate to a trust, the gross value of the estate, is over $100 000 but not over $250 000;
(iii) $250, if the gross value of assets in trust or, if the investigation and audit does not relate to a trust, the gross value of the estate, is over $250 000 but not over $375 000;
(iv) $300, if the gross value of assets in trust or, if the investigation and audit does not relate to a trust, the gross value of the estate, is over $375 000 but not over $500 000;
(v) $350, if the gross value of assets in trust or, if the investigation and audit does not relate to a trust, the gross value of the estate, is over $500 000 but not over $600 000;
(vi) $400, if the gross value of assets in trust or, if the investigation and audit does not relate to a trust, the gross value of the estate, is over $600 000
(a) Acting as a representative under section 5 or an alternate representative under section 6
(i) 3% of the gross sale price of real property sold by an agent,
(ii) 5% of cash received, whether as capital or income, other than from the sale of real property by an agent,
(iii) 5% of the gross value of securities at the time administration commences and 5% of their growth in value,
On commencement of administration and on recognition of capital growth
(iv) 0.4 of 1% per annum, computed monthly, on the gross value of all assets,
(v) 5% of the gross value of assets other than securities;
(b) Investigating, under section 30 (3) or 31, an objection about financial abuse
(i) $125, if the gross value of the adult's assets is not over $100 000;
(ii) $200, if the gross value of the adult's assets is over $100 000 but not over $250 000;
(iii) $250, if the gross value of the adult's assets is over $250 000 but not over $375 000;
(iv) $300, if the gross value of the adult's assets is over $375 000 but not over $500 000;
(v) $350, if the gross value of the adult's assets is over $500 000 but not over $600 000;
(vi) $400, if the gross value of the adult's assets is over $600 000.
Receiving money under section 17 of B.C. Reg. 125/2001
5% of the amount received and 5% of income earned on it.
(a) Examining notice of civil claim under section 61
On service of notice of civil claim
(c) Reviewing and commenting on a proposed settlement of an action brought pursuant to Division 6 of Part 4
(d) Administering the estate of a deceased person or acting under section 110, 164 or 167
(i) (A) 3% of gross value of real property conveyed to beneficiary or heir,
The estate if funds available, otherwise the beneficiary or heir
(B) 5% of gross sale price of real property sold by agent,
(C) 7% of gross sale price of real property sold without agent,
(D) 7% of cash received other than the sale of real property,
(E) 7% of the gross value of securities at the time the administration commences and 7% of their growth in value,
On commencement of administration and on recognition of capital growth
(F) 7% of the gross value of other personal property,

The estate, if the property is sold or if it is transferred or delivered and if funds are available from the estate, or the beneficiary or heir, if the property is transferred or delivered and the funds are not available from the estate
On receipt of proceeds available from the estate, or before transfer or delivery if funds are not available from the estate
(G) If the sum of the amounts payable under clauses (A) through (F) is less than $3 500, then an additional amount is payable in the sum of $3 500 – ((A) + (B) + (C) + (D) + (E) + (F))
The estate, if funds available, otherwise the beneficiary or heir
(ii) 5% of the income earned by estate,
(iii) 0.4 of 1% per annum, computed monthly, on the gross value of all assets,
(iv) $75 per hour for staff time spent identifying, locating and proving heirs.
(e) Reviewing a notice to the court under section 121 (1), or 138 (2) and providing comments under section 124
(f) Acting as representative of estate under section 150
(g) Examining and responding to an application to appoint a trustee to hold and administer a minor's estate under section 153 (3)

Estate Administration Act:
(This item applies only in respect of deaths occurring before March 31, 2014)
(a) Acting as representative of estate under section 9 (1) (b) or sections 59 to 61
(b) Reviewing an application to the court under section 7 or 41 and providing comments
(d) Administering the estate of a deceased person or acting under section 51
(i) (A) 3% of gross value of real property conveyed to beneficiary or heir,
The estate, if funds available, otherwise the beneficiary or heir
(B) 5% of gross sale price of real property sold by agent,
(C) 7% of gross sale price of real property sold without agent,
(D) 7% of cash received other than the sale of real property,
(E) 7% of the gross value of securities at the time administration commences and 7% of their growth in value,
On commencement of administration and on recognition of capital growth
(F) 7% of gross value of other personal property,

The estate, if the property is sold or if it is transferred or delivered and if funds are available from the estate, or the beneficiary or heir, if the property is transferred or delivered and funds are not available from the estate
On receipt of proceeds available from the estate, or before transfer or delivery if funds are not available from the estate
(G) If the sum of the amounts payable under clauses (A) through (F) is less than $3 500, then an additional amount is payable in the sum of $3 500 – ((A) + (B) + (C) + (D) + (E) + (F))
The estate, if funds available, otherwise the beneficiary or heir
(iii) 0.4 of 1% per annum, computed monthly, on the gross value of all assets,
(iv) $75 per hour for staff time spent identifying, locating and proving heirs.

Wills Variation Act:
(This item applies only in respect of deaths occurring before March 31, 2014)
(a) Examining notice of civil claim under section 3
On service of notice of civil claim
(b) Reviewing and commenting on a proposed settlement of a wills variation action
